content:
Tina is employed by Amateur Painters for the summer.  She has a strict $\$1000$ budget to cover the cost of paint and stain. A liter of paint costs $\$10$, and a liter of stain costs $\$20$.

**Write an *inequality* that represents the number of liters of paint $(P)$ and liters of stain $(S)$ Tina can use without exceeding her expense budget.**

[[☃ expression 1]]

**Graph the constraint equation with $P$ on the horizontal axis and $S$ on the vertical axis.**

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]

**If Tina uses $40$ liters of paint $(P)$, which of the following numbers of liters of stain $(S)$ can she use without exceeding the expense budget?** 

[[☃ radio 1]]
